There are loads of comments, but the TPB has added its new anti-moronic comment maker script. You will now only see your own comments, while leaving you with the ability to believe you are actually of any use when everyone else knows the truth.

what does it mean by mount. pls tell me it says "1. Mount Incredibles_Disc1 ISO/CD and install. Click finish and quit." 

"2. Mount PLAY_Disc2 ISO/CD and run the game to complete installation."

"3. Copy the data folder from PLAY_Disc2 to the Games sub directory game.
...(XP Default = c:\Program Files\THQ\Disney\The Incredibles\Game).

"4. Replace IncPC.exe in the Games sub directory game with the one provided.
...(XP Default = c:\Program Files\THQ\Disney\The Incredibles\Game)

"5. Replace Launcher.exe in the Games directory with the one provided
...(XP Default = c:\Program Files\THQ\Disney\The Incredibles)" PLEASE HELP WITH THIS. i tried playing on my laptop (Note book).

Mounting the disk lets your OS access the data on it. You need a virtual drive to mount the image (ISO). You could burn it to a disk in which case it will auto mount the disk once inserted into the drive.  Don't just burn the iso onto a disk, you need to create a disk from image.
